identificationModule.briefTitle: A Safety and Effective Study of Ginkgolides Diterpene Lactone Meglumine Injection in the Treatment of Ischemic Stroke.
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Randomized,Double Blind,Placebo Parallel Controlled,Multicenter Clinical Sthdy of Ginkgo Diterpene Lactone Meglumine Injection for Acute Ischemic Stroke Efficacy Safety.

collaborators.name: Beijing Bionovo Medicine Development Co., Ltd.

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The aim of this study is to evaluate the safety and effectivity of Ginkgo diterpene lactone meglumine injection tn the treatment of acute ischemic stroke
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: After randomized to 90 + 7 days mRS 0-1 points is the Primary Outcome Measure,evaluate the safety and effectivity of Ginkgo diterpene lactone meglumine injection tn the treatment of acute ischemic stroke

armGroups.label: ginkgo diterpene lactone meglumine injection
interventionNames: Drug: Ginkgo diterpene lactone meglumine injection

armGroups.label: Ginkgo diterpene lactone meglumine injection simulation
armGroups.description: Ginkgo diterpene lactone meglumine injection simulation
interventionNames: Drug: Ginkgo diterpene lactone meglumine injection simulation

interventions.name: Ginkgo diterpene lactone meglumine injection
interventions.description: 5 ml/times, 1 time/day.Before use, the drug slowly added to the 0.9% sodium chloride injection diluted in 250 ml, slow intravenous drip.

interventions.name: Ginkgo diterpene lactone meglumine injection simulation
interventions.description: 5 ml/times, 1 time/day.Before use, the drug slowly added to the 0.9% sodium chloride injection diluted in 250 ml, slow intravenous drip.
armGroupLabels: Ginkgo diterpene lactone meglumine injection simulation

primaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients with Modified Rankin Scale (mRS) less than or equal to 1 .

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients with National Institutes of Health Stroke Score (NIHSS) rising 4 or more points, three points, two points, one of the subjects changes from baseline to randomized 7 days.
Proportion of patients with National Institutes of Health Stroke Score (NIHSS) reducing 4 points or more changes from baseline to randomized 7 days,14 days.
Proportion of patients with Modified Rankin Scale (mRS) reaching 0-2 .
The Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) scale changes from baseline to randomized 14 days,90 days.
The EuroQol-5 Dimensions (EQ-5D) scale changes from baseline to randomized 14 days,90 days.
